tuv.seg: Under the Control of Dogs Act 1986, as amended by the Control of Dogs (Amendment) Act 1992, local authorities are responsible for the control of dogs
Faoin Acht um Rialú Madraí 1986 arna leasadh ag an Acht um Rialú Madraí (Leasú) 1992, tá sé de dhualgas ar na húdaráis áitiúla smacht a choinneáil ar mhadraí
They have the power to appoint dog wardens, provide dog shelters, seize dogs, impose on-the-spot fines and take court proceedings against owners
Tá an chumhacht ag na húdaráis áitiúla maoir mhadraí a cheapadh, dídean mhadraí a sholáthar, madraí a ghabháil, fíneáil a dhéanamh ar an spota agus an dlí a chur ar úinéirí
Local authorities may enter into agreements with each other to provide dog wardens and dog shelters
Is féidir leis na húdaráis áitiúla dul isteach i gcomhaontú lena chéile le maoir mhadraí agus dídean mhadraí a sholáthar

Some local authorities may enter into agreements with the Irish Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (ISPCA) or, with permission from the Minister for Housing, Planning, Community and Local Government, a person or organisation connected with animal welfare to provide these services

Is féidir leo freisin dul isteach i gcomhaontú le dreamanna ar nós Cumann na hÉireann um Chosaint Ainmhithe (ISPCA) nó, le cead ón Aire Tithíochta, Pleanála, Pobal agus Rialtais Áitiúil, dul i mbun comhaontaithe le haon duine nó aon eagraíocht a bhaineann le leas ainmhithe leis na seirbhísí seo a sholáthar
You are liable for injury or damage caused by your dog to people or livestock
Tá tú freagrach as aon ghortú nó damáiste ar bith a dhéanann do mhadra do dhaoine nó do stoc
You can be disqualified from keeping a dog if you have been convicted of cruelty to a dog under the Protection of Animals Acts 1911 and 1965
Is féidir bac a chur ort madra a choinneáil más rud é gur chúisíodh tú ar thurcántacht ar mhadra faoi na hAchtanna um Chosaint Ainmhithe 1911 agus 1965
A new system of compulsory microchipping was introduced in 2015 – see ‘Dog identification’ below
Tugadh córas nua isteach i 2015 le madraí a mhicrishliseadh go h-éigeantach - féach 'Aitheantas madra' thíos
In order to get a dog licence, you must be over 16 years of age
Caithfidh tú a bheith os cionn 16 bliana d'aois le ceadúnas madra a fháil
It is an offence to keep a dog unless you have a licence
Is coir atá ann má tá madra agat, mura bhfuil ceadúnas agat
All dogs over 4 months of age must have a licence
Is gá do gach madra os cionn 4 mhí d'aois ceadúnas a bheith aige
Puppies aged under 4 months who are still with their mothers don't need licences, but once they leave their mothers they must have a licence
Ní gá do choileáin faoi bhun 4 mhí ceadúnas a bheith acu, ach nuair fágann siad a máthair, is gá dóibh ceadúnas

Your dog must be accompanied by and be under your effective control or the control of another responsible person if it is outside your home or premises or the home or premises of the person in charge of it

Caithfidh an madra a bheith i gcuideachta agus a bheith faoi smacht éifeachtach duine éigin freagrach má tá an madra taobh amuigh den teach nó áitreabh nó taobh amuigh de theach nó áitreabh an duine atá i bhfeighil ar an ainmhí
A dog warden can ask you to produce evidence of your dog licence and failure to do so can result in an on-the-spot fine
Is féidir leis an maor madra fianaise a iarraidh ort le taispeáint go bhfuil ceadúnas madra agat agus muna ndéanann tú sin is féidir tú a fhíneáil ar an spota
Failure to pay this fine within a specified period can result in prosecution by the local authority
Muna n-íocann tú an fhíneáil seo laistigh den tréimhse atá leagtha síos, is féidir leis an údarás áitiúil tú a chúisiú
Licences are not needed for blind persons' guide dogs; for dogs in the possession of a local authority, the ISPCA or the Gardaí; or for any dog imported into the State for less than 30 days

Ní gá ceadúnas do mhadraí treorach do dhaoine atá dall; do mhadraí atá i seilbh ag údarás áitiúil, ag Cumann na hÉireann um Chosaint Ainmhithe nó ag na Gardaí; ná d'aon mhadra iompórtáilte sa Stát ar feadh níos lú ná 30 lá
Standard annual licences for individual dogs are issued by post offices
Is féidir gnáthcheadúnas bliantúil a fháil ag oifigí poist áitiúla
General dog licences for multiple dogs are issued by local authorities
Eisíonn na h-údaráis áitiúla ceadúnais ghinearálta madra
The revenue from dog licences finances the operation of dog control services
Téann an t-airgead ó cheadúnais mhadra ar aghaidh chun seirbhísí smachta madraí a mhaoiniú
The Dog Breeding Establishments Act 2010 introduced a 'lifetime of dog' licence, which is issued by local authorities
Chuir an tAcht um Bunachais Pórúcháin Madraí 2010 ceadúnas 'saolré an mhadra' ar bun. Eisíonn na h-údaráis áitiúla na ceadúnais seo
Dogs must at all times wear a collar that bears the name and the address of the owner inscribed on it or on a plate, badge or disc
Caithfidh madraí coiléar buan a chaitheamh le ainm agus seoladh an úinéara scríofa air nó is féidir é a bheith ar phláta, ar shuaitheantas nó ar dhiosc
Failure to have identification on a dog can result in an on-the-spot fine issued by a dog warden
Muna bhfuil aitheantas de chineál éigin agat ar do mhadra is féidir leis an maor madra tú a fhíneáil ar an spota
Failure to pay this fine within a specific period can result in prosecution by the local authority
Muna n-íocann tú an fhíneáil seo laistigh den thréimhse atá leagtha síos, is féidir tú a chúisiú
Under the Microchipping of Dogs Regulations 2015, a programme of microchipping has been introduced
Faoi na Rialacháin um Micrishliseadh Madraí 2015, tugadh córas nua isteach le madraí a mhicrishliseadh go h-éigeantach

• Any pup born since 1 June 2015 must be microchipped and registered on an authorised database (pdf) by the time it reaches the age of 12 weeks or if it leaves the property on which it was born before the age of 12 weeks
• Caitear gach hóga a rugadh ó 1 Meitheamh 2015 i leith a mhicrishliseadh agus a chlárú ar bhunachar sonraí atá údaraithe (pdf)
• Since 31 March 2016, the Regulations apply to all dogs
• Ó 31 Márta 2016, tá na Rialacháin i nbhfeidhm i leith ghach madra
• If your dog is already microchipped, you now have to register it as well
• Má tá do mhadra micrishliste cheana féin, tá ort anois é a chlárú freisin
Read more in this press release and in these Frequently Asked Questions (pdf)
Faigh tuilleadh eolais sa phreasráiteas seo agus sna Ceisteanna Coitianta (pdf)
Stray dogs are dogs that are in a public place and are not accompanied by the owner or a responsible person
'Sé an rud atá i gceist le madraí seachráin, na madraí atá in áit phoiblí agus nach bhfuil an t-úinéir nó duine éigin freagrach ina gcuideachta
Dogs that are not under proper control are also considered stray dogs
Glactar leis go bhfuil madraí ar seachrán muna bhfuil siad faoi smacht ceart
You can receive an on-the-spot fine if your dog is not under proper control
Muna bhfuil do mhadra faoi smacht ceart, d’fhéadfadh fíneáil ar an spota a fháil
Stray dogs may be seized by the dog warden and the Gardaí and brought to a dog pound
Is féidir leis an maor madraí agus na Gardaí, madraí atá ar seachrán a ghabháil agus iad a thabhairt go dtí an póna madraí áitiúil
These dogs may be put down or re-homed if their owners do not claim them within 5 days
Is féidir na madraí seo a chur síos nó fáil réidh leo muna dtagann a n-úinéirí a n-iarraidh laistigh de thréimhse 5 lá
If your dog has strayed or is missing, you should contact the local dog pound directly to check if your dog is there
Má tá madra agat atá ar strae nó caillte, ba cheart duit teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an bpóna madraí áitiúil chun seiceáil a dhéanamh ar ghabháladh é
Before you collect it, you will have to pay a re-claim fee and produce a current dog licence
Sula mbaillíonn tú an madra, beidh ort táille athéilimh a íoc agus ceadúnas madra reatha a sholáthar
If you do not have a current dog licence, you must get one before collecting your dog
Muna bhfuil ceadúnas madra reatha agat caithfidh tú ceann a cheannacht in oifig an phoist áitiúil sula mbaillíonn tú an madra
Unwanted dogs should be brought to the dog pound
Ba cheart iad a thabhairt go dtí an póna madraí
There may be a charge for accepting them – check this with your local pound
Gearrann pónaí áirithe táille as madra a ghlacadh - fiafraigh den phóna mar gheall ar seo
Local authorities have the power to accept unwanted dogs and put them down if they cannot be rehomed or transferred to an animal welfare group
Tá sé de chumhacht ag an údarás áitiúil madraí a thógáil isteach agus iad a mharú nó fáil réidh leo muna bhfaightear áit fhóirstineach dóibh
Dog wardens have the power to request the name and address of a person suspected of an offence under the Control of Dogs Act
Tá an chumhacht ag an maor madraí ainm agus seoladh a iarraidh ar an té atá in amhras maidir le coir faoin Acht um Rialú Madraí
They also have the power to seize and detain any dog and to enter any premises, other than a residence, to seize and detain a dog
Tá an chumhacht acu madra a ghabháil agus é a choinneáil agus tá sé de chead acu dul isteach in aon áitreabh seachas áit chónaithe chun madra a ghabháil nó a thógáil
You are guilty of an offence and can be arrested by a Garda if you obstruct a dog warden in the course of his or her work, refuse to give your name and address or give a false name and address

Tá tú ciontach ar choir agus is féidir leis na Gardaí tú a ghabháil má chuireann tú bac ar an maor madraí agus é nó í i mbun a gcuid oibre nó má dhiúltaíonn tú d' ainm agus do sheoladh a thabhairt nó ainm agus seoladh bréagach a thabhairt
Many local authorities have introduced bye-laws to indicate areas where dogs must be kept on a leash or even prohibited
Tá go leor dlíthe curtha i bhfeidhm ag na húdaráis áitiúla a léiríonn na ceantair ina gcaithfear madraí a choinneáil ar iall nó na ceantair a bhfuil cosc iomlán ar mhadraí
Your local authority will be able to inform you of the bye-laws that apply in your area
Beidh d'údarás áitiúil in ann tú a chur ar an eolas maidir leis na fodhlíthe atá i bhfeidhm i do cheantar
Breaches of these bye-laws can result in fines on summary conviction
Má bhristear na fodhlíthe maidir le madraí i do cheantar, 'sé an toradh a bheidh air ná fíneáil ar chiontú achomaire
Under Section 22 of the Litter Pollution Act 1997 it is an offence to allow a dog under your control to foul a public place
Faoi Alt 22 don Acht Truailliú Brúscair 1997 is coir atá ann cead a ligean do mhadra faoi do smacht áit phoiblí a shalú
This means the owner or person in charge of the dog is required to remove dog faeces and dispose of them in a suitable, sanitary manner
Ciallaíonn sé seo de réir dlí, go bhfuil sé suas ag an úinéir nó an duine atá i bhfeighil ar an mhadra an fearadh a ghlanadh ar bealach atá cóir ó thaobh na sláintíochta de
You can complain to the District Court under the litter laws against an owner or someone in charge of a dog who allows that dog to foul public places and who fails to act responsibly

Is féidir leat gearán a dhéanamh chuig an gCúirt Dúiche in aghaidh an úinéara nó duine atá i bhfeighil ar an mhadra a thugann cead do mhadra áit phoiblí a shalú agus nach dtógann freagracht as gníomhaíochtaí an mhadra
Before you do this, you must first inform the dog owner of your intention by completing a special form available from the Dog Control Unit of your local authority
Caithfidh tú an t-úinéir a chur ar an eolas maidir leis an ghníomhaíocht atá i gceist agat tré foirm iarratais speisialta a líonadh isteach
Read more about litter laws
Léigh tuilleadh faoi na dlithe brúscair
Excessive dog barking that causes a nuisance is an offence
Is coir é nuair atá madra ag tafann an-iomarca agus é ina ábhar núis
You may be able to solve such problems by talking to the dog owner
B’fhéidir go mbeidh tú in ann na fadhbanna sin a réiteach trí chaint le húinéir an mhadra
If you don’t get a satisfactory response, you may complain to the District Court and seek a hearing
Mura bhfaigheann tú freagairt shásúil, féadfaidh tú gearán a dhéanamh leis an gCúirt Dúiche agus éisteacht a lorg
When you have received a court date, you must inform the dog owner of your complaint by using the form prescribed for this purpose under Section 25 of the Control of Dogs Act 1986
Nuair a bhíonn dáta cúirte agat, ní mór duit úinéir an mhadra a chur ar an eolas faoi do ghearán tríd an bhfoirm a úsáid a fhorordaítear don chuspóir seo faoi Alt 25 den Acht um Rialú Madraí, 1986
These forms are available from the District Courts and from local authorities
Tá fáil ar na foirmeacha seo ó na Cúirteanna Dúiche agus ó údaráis áitiúla
The court may make an order requiring the occupier of the premises in which the dog is kept to abate the nuisance by exercising due control over a dog
Féadfaidh an chúirt ordú a dhéanamh a cheanglaíonn ar áititheoir an áitribh ina gcoimeádtar an madra chun deireadh a chur leis an núis trí mhadra a rialú go cuí
The court may limit the number of dogs that can be kept on a premises or may direct that a dog be delivered to a dog warden to be dealt with as unwanted
Féadfaidh an chúirt líon na madraí is féidir a choimeád ar áitreabh a theorannú nó a ordú go dtugtar madra do mhaor madraí go ndéileálfar leis an madra mar mhadra gan iarraidh
A guard dog used at a non-residential business premises must be either accompanied by a handler or secured so that it cannot roam freely around the premises or escape

Caithfidh duine éigin a bheith in éineacht le madra cosanta nó é a choinneáil sabháilte sa dóigh is nach féidir leis a bheith ag siúl thart saor nó nár féidir leis éalú, má tá sé in áit neamh-chónaithe
A notice must be displayed at the entrance, informing the public that a guard dog is on the premises
Caithfear fógra a chrochadh ar an bhealach isteach leis an phobal a chur ar an eolas go bhfuil madra cosanta ar an láthair
The guard dog must wear a collar displaying the name and address of its owner
Caithfidh an madra cosanta coiléar a chaitheamh ag tabhairt ainm agus seoladh an úinéara
It must also carry an electronic implant containing a permanent identification mark provided by the ISPCA
Caithfidh an madra ionchlannán leictreonach a bheith ar a chorp le marc aitheantais buan air a tugadh don mhadra ón ISPCA
This implant must be inserted by or under the direct supervision of a veterinary surgeon authorised by the ISPCA
Caithfidh an ionchlannán a bheith sáite sa mhadra faoi chúram dochtúir tréadliachta atá glactha leis ag an ISPCA
The dog owner is responsible for the cost involved in inserting the implant
Tá úinéir an mhadra freagrach as na costais a bhaineann leis an ionchlannán
Kennels where more than 5 guard dogs aged over 4 months are kept must register with the local authority
Má tá conchróite le níos mó na 5 mhadra cosanta agus iad níos mó ná 4 mhí d'aois, caithfear iad a chlárú leis an údarás áitiúil
There are specific rules on the keeping of guard dogs: the Control of Dogs Act 1986 (Guard Dog) Regulations 1989
Léigh tuilleadh faoi na rialacha seo sna Rialacháin faoin Acht um Rialú Madraí 1986 (Madra Cosanta) 1989
Rules relating to certain breeds of dog
Rialacha maidir le cineálacha póir madraí
The Control of Dogs Regulations 1998 impose additional rules in relation to the following breeds (and strains/cross-breeds) of dog:
Cuireann Rialacháin um Rialú Madraí 1998 rialacha sa bhreis maidir le cineálacha póir madraí seo a leanas (agus tréithchineál/traspóradh)
• American pit bull terrier
• American Pit Bull Terrier
• Be kept on a short strong lead by a person over 16 years who is capable of controlling them
• Go gcaithfear na madraí seo (nó tréithchinéal agus traspóradh dóibh) a bheith coinnithe ar iallachta gairid láidir ag duine atá os cionn 16 bliana d'aois agus atá in ann smacht a choinneáil orthu
• Be muzzled whenever they are in a public place
• Caithfear soc béil a chur ar na madraí ( nó tréithchinéal agus traspóradh dóibh) nuair atá siad in áit phoiblí
• Wear a collar bearing the name and address of their owner at all times
• Caithfidh na madraí seo (nó tréithchinéal agus tras-póradh dóibh) coiléar a chaitheamh an t-am ar fad le ainm agus seoladh an úinéara
The rules on muzzling and leashing do not apply to dogs used by the Gardaí, the Dublin Harbour Police, State Airport Police and bona fide rescue teams in rescue operations
Ní bhaineann na rialacha seo le madraí a úsaideann na Gardaí, Gardaí Calafoirt Bhaile Átha Cliath, Gardaí ar Aerfort Stáit agus foirne tarrthála bona fide agus iad i nbun gníomhaíochta sábháltachta
The rules on muzzling do not apply to guide dogs for the blind
Ní bhaineann na rialacha maidir le soc béil leis na madraí treorach a bhíonn ag an dream atá dall
Local authorities have the power to introduce bye-laws relating to dog control
Tá cumhacht ag údaráis áitiúla fodhlíthe maidir le rialú a thabhairt isteach
You should be aware that the penalties listed below are a guide; fines in your area may be higher
Is treoir iad ná pionóis liosaithe thíos. D’fhéadfadh an fineálacha i do cheantar bheith níos airde

No dog licence On-the-spot fine: €100 payable to your local authority Failure to pay on-the-spot fines can lead to prosecution in District Court with a maximum fine of €2,500 and/or 3 months' imprisonment

Gan ceadúnas madra Fíneáil ar an spota: €100 agus é iníoctha leis an údarás áitiúil Muna n-íocann tú an fhíneáil ar an spota is féidir tú a chúisiú sa Chúirt Dúiche le uasmhéid fíneála de €2,500 agus/nó téarma príosúnachta 3 mhí

No identification on dog On-the-spot fine: €100 payable to your local authority Failure to pay on-the-spot fines can lead to prosecution in District Court with a maximum fine of €2,500 and/or 3 months' imprisonment Stray dog Dog pound re-claim fee of €20

Gan aitheantas ar an madra Fíneáil ar an spota: €100 agus é iníoctha leis an údarás áitiúil Muna n-íocann tú an fhíneáil ar an spota is féidir tú a chúisiú sa Chúirt Dúiche le uasmhéid fíneála de €2,500 agus/nó téarma príosúnachta 3 mhí
Charge of €8 for every night dog is in pound
Madra ar strae Tá táille athéilimh de €20 ag an phóna madra
The pound will hold a dog for at least 5 days. Dogs not re-claimed from the dog pound within 5 days may be put down, rehomed or transferred to an animal welfare group
Tá costas €8 in aghaidh na h-oíche a chaitheann an madra sa phóna Faightear réidh leo nó cuirtear síos madraí muna dtagann éinne a lorg i ndiaidh 5 lá

Dog not kept under control On-the-spot fine of €100 payable to your local authority Failure to pay on-the-spot fines can lead to prosecution in District Court with a maximum fine of €2,500 and/or 3 months' imprisonment

Madraí nach gcoinnítear faoi smacht Fíneáil ar an spota €100 iníoctha leis an údarás áitiúil Muna n-íocann tú an fhíneáil ar an spota is féidir tú a chúisiú sa Chúirt Dúiche le uasmhéid fíneála de €2,500 agus/nó téarma príosúnachta 3 mhí
Breach of bye-laws (setting out times when dog may be unleashed in public) Fines up to €2,500 on conviction
Ag briseadh fodhlíthe ( ag leagaint amach amanna gur féidir le madraí a bheith in áit phoiblí gan iall) Fíneáil suas go dtí €2,500 má chúisítear tú
Dog fouling public place Owners/handlers who do not dispose of dog faeces in a responsible manner may receive an on-the-spot fine of €150
Madra ag salú in áit phoiblí Muna bhfaigheann úinéirí nó an duine atá i bhfeighil an madra réitigh don bhfearadh ar bealach atá freagrach is féidir leis / léi a bheith fíneáilte ar an spota €150
Failure to pay on-the-spot fines can lead to prosecution in District Court with a maximum fine of €3,000 and €600 per day for continuing offences on summary conviction
Muna n-íocann tú an fhíneáil ar an spota is féidir tú a chúisiú sa Chúirt Dúiche le uasmhéid fíneála de €3,000 agus €600 sa lá do chiontí leanúnach
An individual dog licence costs €20 and is valid for one year
Cosnaíonn ceadúnas madra €20 agus é dlisteanach do thréimhse bliana
A general dog licence costs €400 and is valid for one year
Cosnaíonn ceadúnas ginearálta madra €400 agus é dlisteanach do thréimhse bliana
A 'lifetime of dog' licence costs €140
Cosnaíonn ceadúnas 'saolré an mhadra' €140

The Department of Housing, Planning, Community and Local Government publishes detailed information on its website, including guidelines under the Dog Breeding Establishments Act and statistics on dog control

Foilsíonn an Roinn Tithíochta, Pleanála, Pobail agus Rialtais Áitiúil faisnéis mhionsonraithe ar a láithreán gréasáin, lena n-áirítear treoirlínte faoin Acht um Bunachais Pórúcháin Madraí agus faoi staitisticí ar rialú madraí
For a dog licence
Chun ceadúnas a fháil
You can get an individual dog licence at your local post office
Is féidir gnáthcheadúnas do mhadra aonair a fháil in oifig an phoist
For a general dog licence or a 'lifetime of dog' licence, apply to your local authority
Má tá ceadúnas ginearálta madra nó ceadúnas 'saolré an mhadra' uait, iarr ar an údarás áitiúil
To microchip and register your dog
Chun do mhadra a mhicrishliseadh agus a chlárú
Contact your vet or else one of the authorised databases (pdf)
Déan teagmháil le do thréidlia nó le bunachar sonraí atá údaraithe (pdf)
Irish Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals
Cumann na hÉireann um Chosaint Ainmhithe
